Legal_Issue: Was the Board's conclusion that the applicant had an Internal Flight Alternative (IFA) in Kiev reasonable?
Outcome: Application for judicial review allowed; decision quashed and remanded for re-determination
Evidence_Type: Gender-specific hardships, employment discrimination, domestic abuse
Application_Error: Inadequate analysis of second prong of IFA test – failure to consider gender-specific conditions
Review_Outcome: Decision set aside, case remanded to a different panel
Evidence_Ignored: Gender-specific hardships, employment discrimination faced by female applicants in Kiev
Application_Factor: Two-prong IFA test: (1) no serious possibility of persecution; (2) reasonable conditions for refuge
Decision_Outcome: Refugee claim dismissed based on alleged IFA in Kiev
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: IFA test under IRPA, UNHCR Gender Guidelines
Cause_of_Refusal: Alleged availability of Internal Flight Alternative in Kiev
Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to assess evidence on gender-based challenges in internal relocation
Procedural_Fairness: Insufficient reasoning on key aspect of claim – gender-specific risks
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge to reasonableness of Board’s IFA finding
Jurisdictional_Focus: Ukraine, internal flight alternative in Kiev
Relevant_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, Charter of Rights and Freedoms (implied)
Omission_Type: Failure to apply Gender Guidelines in assessing IFA conditions
